instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message:
Have this board (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) that came in with no image or backlight on the display. <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> both reading 0volts. 
i've confirmed its not the display. I also replaced the lvds connector.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_FUSED</SIGNAL> - 12.4

Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message:
Do you get external image?
Also check for USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message: No external image and yes, i have usb activity. Could this be the graphics mux <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message:
Missing external and internal image, as backlight too, points to GPU.

"i have usb activity"
Flashing Link LED of OSX pendrive?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message:
USB activity: Basically pulsing LED. 
The frame boots up with keyboard backlight coming on around the time the OS should be fully loaded.

So if it is the GPU, that would mean the main GPU is what is bad, correct, and so bypassing the second GPU (higher graphic GPU) won't solve this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message:
There is a hardware method to disable GPU on this board.
I never tried it yet.
I suppose Google can find something...

BTW, once keyboard is already connected, check if Caps Lock reacts too; at least when its backlight comes on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message:
I've used the hardware mode and basically disables the AMD GPU. But each time I did use the mode, I was always able to initially boot into safe mode before the mode was applied. This time around, i can't even get into safe mode. 

No, the caps lock isn't responding. 
I'm however able to insert and eject a cd

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message: If no USB activity, you have other problem, apart of video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message: Did you mean if I didn?t have cap lock? Cause I do have usb activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message: How did you check USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message: Connected an external hdd and the drive had activity, granted no real way to tell if it was transmitting data, just the sound of the drive motors and the led flashing to signify comm activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message:
Looks like USB activity confirmed.

Do PRAM reset and try again to disable GPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message: There appears to be other issues with the board that may be linked. I can't perform PRAM reset, as in the board is not responding to the key commands. I am however able to perform the SMC reset.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message:
SMC reset is hardware, not software.
Did you try connecting USB keyboard on each port?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No imaged or backlight on display
threads.message: With USB keyboard it worked. It appears i've got corroded via's. This may very well be the same issue that's causing my video issue, corrosion. Looking deeper into the board, it appears the previous owner or shop had performed corrosion cleaning of the board. I'm thinking i'm done with this board.
